intro: Astragalus caeruleopetalinus var. glabricarpus, commonly known as the blue-petaled milkvetch, is a perennial legume native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces pods that are smooth and glabrous. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and restoration projects.
